definitions: causing a feeling of calm and peace, reducing stress or tension
examples: A relaxing massage helped ease her shoulder pain
The spa offers many relaxing treatments for stressed clients

definitions: in the act of freeing, discharging, or making something available
examples: The releasing mechanism triggered the parachute to open
They scheduled a releasing ceremony for the rescued birds

definitions: showing no mercy or compassion; harsh and inflexible in attitude
continuing in a determined way without any interruption or weakening
examples: The relentless judge gave maximum sentences to all defendants
His relentless criticism destroyed her confidence over time
The relentless rain continued for three straight days
She maintained relentless pressure until they agreed

definitions: needing or depending on someone or something for support or help
examples: The elderly woman was reliant on her daughter's care
Modern society is heavily reliant on technology

definitions: feeling happy and relaxed because something difficult or unpleasant has ended
examples: She felt relieved when the test results came back negative
The relieved parents hugged their found child tightly

definitions: having been voluntarily given up, abandoned, or handed over to another
examples: The relinquished throne remained empty for months
His relinquished dreams still haunted him years later

definitions: having been moved from one place or position to another location
examples: The relocated office was closer to public transportation
Many relocated families struggled to adjust to their new city

definitions: intended to correct, improve, or cure something that is wrong or deficient
providing instruction in basic skills to students who need extra help
examples: The doctor prescribed remedial exercises for her injured knee
Remedial massage therapy helped reduce his chronic pain
She enrolled in remedial math to improve her skills
The school offers remedial reading classes every afternoon

definitions: tending to remind one of something; awakening memories of similar things
examples: The old song was reminiscent of her childhood summers
His writing style is reminiscent of classic literature

definitions: filled with deep regret or guilt for a wrong committed
examples: The remorseful teenager apologized to everyone he hurt
She wrote a remorseful letter after realizing her mistake

definitions: capable of being removed, taken off, or separated from something else
examples: The jacket has removable sleeves for warmer weather
These stickers are removable without leaving any residue

definitions: taken away from a particular place or separated from something
separated by a particular number of steps in family relationship
examples: The removed furniture left empty spaces in the room
All removed items were stored in the basement
My second cousin once removed lives in another country
She's my great aunt twice removed on my mother's side

definitions: of, relating to, or located in the region of the kidneys
examples: The patient suffered from chronic renal failure
Renal function tests showed concerning results

definitions: rejecting conventional behavior or allegiance; acting in rebellion against authority
examples: The renegade soldier refused to follow unjust orders
A renegade group broke away from the main organization

definitions: capable of being renewed, restored, or replenished, especially naturally
examples: Solar power is a renewable energy source
The library card has a renewable membership each year

definitions: restored to a fresh, vigorous, or flourishing condition after decline
examples: Their renewed friendship was stronger than before
She attacked the project with renewed enthusiasm

definitions: in the process of restoring, replenishing, or making something fresh again
examples: The renewing rain brought life to the drought-stricken land
A renewing facial treatment left her skin glowing

definitions: known and admired by many people for special achievements or qualities
examples: The renowned scientist won multiple Nobel prizes
This restaurant is renowned for its authentic Italian cuisine

definitions: of, relating to, or available for rent rather than purchase
examples: They stayed in a rental cottage during their vacation
The rental equipment must be returned by Monday

definitions: having been organized again or differently, with a new structure
examples: The reorganised company had fewer management levels
Her reorganised closet made finding clothes much easier

definitions: having been organized again or differently, with a new structure
examples: The reorganized department runs more efficiently now
A reorganized filing system saved hours of searching

definitions: capable of being done, performed, or occurring again with consistent results
examples: The experiment produced repeatable results every time
This simple recipe is easily repeatable at home

definitions: done, said, or occurring again several times, especially at intervals
examples: Despite repeated warnings, he continued smoking
The repeated knocking grew louder and more insistent

definitions: able to repel or drive away something, or causing disgust and aversion
examples: The spray acts as a repellent barrier against mosquitoes
His repellent behavior made everyone avoid him

definitions: driving back or away by force or influence; causing aversion
examples: The repelling magnetic forces pushed the objects apart
Her repelling personality made making friends difficult

definitions: feeling or expressing sincere regret and remorse for wrongdoing
examples: The repentant thief returned all the stolen goods
His repentant tears showed genuine sorrow for his actions

definitions: characterized by unnecessary and tedious repetition, often boring or irritating
examples: The speaker's repetitious presentation put everyone to sleep
Her repetitious complaints about work became tiresome

definitions: containing or characterized by repetition, especially when unnecessary or monotonous
examples: Factory workers often perform repetitive tasks all day
The repetitive music gave her a terrible headache

definitions: able to be replaced by someone or something else when necessary
examples: Most employees worried they were easily replaceable
The battery is replaceable when it stops holding charge

definitions: filled or well-supplied with something; abundantly provided or furnished
examples: The mansion was replete with priceless antique furniture
His speech was replete with references to classical literature

definitions: stated or claimed by someone, though not necessarily confirmed as true
examples: The reported earnings exceeded analyst expectations
Several reported sightings of the suspect proved false

definitions: deserving censure or condemnation; extremely bad and deserving of criticism
examples: His reprehensible treatment of animals led to criminal charges
Stealing from charity is particularly reprehensible behavior

definitions: capable of being represented, depicted, or described in some form
examples: Complex emotions aren't always representable in simple words
The data is easily representable in graph form

definitions: relating to art that depicts objects or scenes from reality recognizably
examples: Her representational paintings captured landscapes beautifully
The museum featured both abstract and representational artwork

definitions: portrayed, depicted, or presented in a particular way or form
examples: Women are poorly represented in executive positions
The data represented shows a clear upward trend

definitions: kept under control, restrained, or suppressed, especially emotions or memories
examples: His repressed anger finally exploded after years
Repressed memories from childhood suddenly resurfaced

definitions: actively holding back, restraining, or preventing the expression of something
examples: Repressing emotions can lead to psychological problems
The repressing force kept the spring compressed

definitions: inhibiting or restraining personal freedom, especially through authoritarian control
examples: The repressive government banned all forms of protest
She grew up in a repressive household with strict rules

definitions: capable of being reproduced or replicated, especially with consistent results
examples: Scientific experiments must yield reproducible results
The artist's technique is easily reproducible by students

definitions: relating to or affecting the process of producing offspring or copies
examples: The reproductive system includes various organs and hormones
Certain chemicals can damage reproductive health

definitions: of, relating to, or characteristic of reptiles
coldly calculating and unfeeling in manner or appearance
examples: The zoo's reptilian exhibit features snakes and lizards
Scientists study reptilian evolution through fossil records
His reptilian gaze made everyone feel uncomfortable
She responded with reptilian coldness to his plea

definitions: extremely distasteful and unacceptable; arousing disgust or aversion
examples: The idea of eating insects is repugnant to many people
His racist views are repugnant to modern society

definitions: arousing intense distaste or disgust; extremely unpleasant or offensive
examples: The repulsive smell made everyone leave the room
His repulsive table manners ruined the dinner party

definitions: having a good reputation and worthy of trust; known to be reliable
examples: She only buys from reputable online retailers
The reputable law firm has served clients for decades

definitions: asked for politely or formally; sought or demanded as necessary
examples: The requested documents arrived within two business days
Please provide all requested information on the form

definitions: required by circumstances or regulations; necessary for a particular purpose
examples: She lacks the requisite experience for the senior position
Students must complete all requisite courses before graduating

definitions: saved from a dangerous, harmful, or distressing situation
examples: The rescued hikers thanked their brave rescuers
All rescued animals receive medical care at the shelter

definitions: feeling or expressing bitterness or indignation at unfair treatment
examples: He remained resentful about being passed over for promotion
The resentful employee spread negativity throughout the office

definitions: slow to reveal emotion or opinions; restrained in manner
kept for a particular person or purpose; booked in advance
examples: Her reserved nature made it hard to know her thoughts
The reserved gentleman rarely spoke at social gatherings
These seats are reserved for elderly passengers
We have a table reserved at the restaurant tonight

definitions: established in a new place to live, especially after displacement
examples: The resettled refugees slowly adapted to their new country
Many families were resettled after the natural disaster
